Title: Workflow Controller
RoleDescription:
Workflow Controller
 
Compensation: The salary range [or base pay] for this position is $119,202.00- $132,446.50per year . The base salary [or base pay] offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.
The Workflow Controller plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site specific goals across Wayfair's Fulfillment Network. They work to ensure the accurate, timely, and cost efficient processing of the perfect order to our customers.
What You'll Do

You will create daily operating plans for a site and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for building plans at this cadence to align with Site Director and network priorities
Act as the site labor planning champion, taking full ownership of all labor planning inputs such as headcount, UPH for each process path, flow paths, absenteeism, attrition and product mix and determine the labor capacity needed across each process path on a daily and weekly basis to achieve business objectives
Develop a system for risk management based on demand and capacity of Critical Pull Times (CPTs) for customer orders; proactively monitor risk and recommend actions to Operations team to mitigate risk
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
Youll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan - i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
Work in close collaboration with Sales and Operations Planning, Workforce Management, peer Workflow Controllers and Fulfillment Improvement Team to enable performance management improvements

What You'll Need

3+ years operational experience in distribution or manufacturing.
Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Capacity Planning experience or Industrial Engineering background focused on operations flow and labor management
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements

Title: Senior Product Manager, Fulfillment Orchestration
RoleDescription:
An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy and Salary: 
Please note that this is a hybrid role based in Boston, MA, and will require you to work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays.
The salary range for this position is $161,000 - $172,500 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will also be provided as part of the compensation package.
 
Who We Are
 
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our Product team plays a critical role in making this vision a reality by building technology that solves meaningful customer problems in elegant, scalable, and measurable ways. We work closely with Engineering, Experience Design, Analytics, Third Party system and service providers and business leaders across the company to bring these solutions to life.
 
We are seeking an experienced Senior Product Manager for Supply Chain and Retail Technology to lead a strategic initiative focused on transforming our last mile delivery platform. This includes integrating with third-party execution systems and logistics partners to streamline and scale delivery operations across North America and the UK. In this role, you will optimize the end-to-end shipment execution lifecycle for a diverse carrier landscape to reduce friction in the delivery process, and strong business performance. 
 
Youll act as a connective tissue between engineering, business stakeholders, operations, and external partners to deliver scalable and resilient solutions that power key business functions. This is a high-impact role for someone who thrives in cross-functional environments, can manage complex technical ecosystems, and is passionate about building foundational infrastructure that improves operational efficiency.
 
What youll do:

Building out the fulfillment management system (FMS) by supporting new use cases for fulfillment and furthering the orchestrator role that FMS plays across Wayfair supply chain 
Leading Cross-Functional Initiatives: Acting as the product lead for major, time-sensitive programs like 3P WMS integration, Multichannel capabilities, Delivery Services, Multi-carrier multi-leg, and Fareye integration initiatives
Unlocking new use cases based on the fulfillment state: Defining and implementing the use cases to predict delays and communicating an updated delivery promise where possible, by partnering closely with other tech teams 
Defining a repository of future looking use cases for FMS:  Through learnings from the existing capabilities, and strong product discovery, define a strong roadmap of use cases that FMS should support in the mid to long term.
Lead discovery efforts to gather and translate internal and external partner needs into clear business and technical requirements.
Collaborate independently with stakeholders, internal technology teams across supply chain, storefront and supplier-facing to drive improvements in speed, cost and customer experience metrics.
Work closely with Engineering, Operations, Commercial, and External partners to deliver on your roadmap and improve team execution.

 
We Are A Match Because You Have:

7+ years of product management experience, ideally focused on enterprise platforms, or integrations.
Strong track record of product discovery, defining the right problems to solve, and executing deliverables to solve those problems and unlock business outcomes
Comfortable discussing system workflows, tech design, and architecture decisions with engineers.
Experience in managing complex projects involving multiple cross-functional teams. 
Skilled at managing stakeholders, including senior leadership, and translating technical concepts for non-technical audiences.
Strong communicator with a proven ability to collaborate across engineering, operations, and external partners. 
Positive, collaborative, and energetic approach to teamwork.

Title: Recruiter, Field Leadership, Contract
RoleDescription:
The base pay for this position is $29 - $33 per hour. The base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
This position is a contract Recruiter role that requires working full-time and standard business hours, Monday-Friday. This position is a hybrid in-office position and is required to be in office a minimum of 2 days a week with flexibility to attend community events on top of 2 days in office.
Open to candidates in: Lathrop (CA), Perris (CA), Lancaster (TX), or Romeoville (IL). 4-6 month contract position with potential to convert to a permanent position based on business needs.
Who We Are
Wayfair Recruiters are true business partners who are charged with finding, attracting, and hiring top talent into all parts of the company against a high bar for performance, potential, and culture. We are seeking an experienced Recruiter for our Field Leadership Recruiting team to primarily support leadership hiring across the NA Supply Chain and flex across other parts of the business as needed. As a candidates first point of contact with Wayfair, you act as a talent and brand ambassador. With hiring managers, you are a consultative thought partner, working to provide industry insight and process recommendations. If you're interested in learning more about us and want to gain insight into our dynamic, team oriented environment that encourages learning and growth, apply today!
What Youll Do

Drive the full lifecycle recruiting process including sourcing, screening, interviewing, evaluating and offer negotiation, with both passive and active candidates across a variety of roles and levels, to meet established metrics.
Develop and execute creative sourcing strategies to attract, nurture and engage passive talent pools .
Maintain accuracy within ATS/recruiting tools and effectively leverage these tools to deliver results.
Build strong relationships with stakeholders and peers through well structured, frequent communication and reporting.
Effectively set and manage expectations with hiring managers and/or cross functional partners while educating them on the recruiting lifecycle.
Drive a world class candidate experience using empathy and transparency with candidates. 
Leverage data and critical thinking to diagnose recruiting challenges and guide search strategy.
Operate cross functionally and collaboratively in a culture of continuous improvement.

What Youll Need

1+ years of full cycle recruitment/sourcing experience in a corporate and/or agency environment.
Strong relationship management skills with an ability to build trust and credibility with both candidates and hiring managers.
Proven organizational skills with attention to detail and the ability to prioritize and work well in an environment with competing demands.
Familiarity and comfort with a data driven environment. 
Ability to use metrics to guide decision-making.
Partnership skills, action-oriented mind-set, and an ability to be responsive, tactful, and diplomatic.
Experience in recruiting for supply chain leadership roles is a plus.

Title: Chief Marketing Officer, Specialty Retail Brands
RoleDescription:
The base salary for this position is $216,000 - $228,000 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. This role is eligible for annual equity grants subject to Board approval and company performance. Typical grant ranges vary by level and may significantly impact total compensation.
Wayfairs Specialty Brands - AllModern, Birch Lane, and Joss & Main - are seeking a Chief Marketing Officer to drive the next chapter of growth. This executive will lead the brand and marketing strategy across our three distinct lifestyle brands, each with unique customer segments and positioning. With an ambitious roadmap that includes expanding brand awareness, growing our customer base, and scaling into physical retail, the CMO will play a critical role in shaping the future of these businesses.
The CMO will oversee a team of 25+ marketers and steward a significant media investment across brand, performance, CRM, promotions, on-site experience, and retail marketing. Were looking for a strategic and hands-on leader with deep expertise in both brand building and performance marketing - someone who thrives in fast-paced, entrepreneurial environments and brings proven success in the consumer goods and/or retail sectors.
This Boston-based role reports directly to the Wayfair Global CMO and partners closely with the General Manager of Specialty Brands as part of their leadership team.
What youll do

Own and oversee the management of a ~$100M+ advertising budget across all key platforms and channels, including, but not limited to, Google, Meta, Pinterest, TikTok, Audio and CTV partners, and relevant agencies (e.g. Org Social).
Develop and execute an integrated, multi-channel marketing strategy aligned with overall business goals and market-specific nuances.
Manage and optimize marketing initiatives across all key channels, including SEM, PLA, paid social, email marketing, SMS/Push notifications, display advertising, influencer/affiliate marketing, partnerships, online video, CTV/TV and more.
Leverage market insights across both our B2C and B2B customer segments to identify and prioritize opportunities for growth, customer acquisition, retention, and brand positioning.
Be the steward of each brand, working and driving key priorities with the dedicated Specialty Retail Creative team and the broader brand organization to ensure an elevated positioning and consistent brand presentation in line with the brand strategy.  
Analyze business performance and use data-driven decision-making processes to refine marketing strategies and optimize performance.
Stay current with evolving technology and identify ways to leverage it to drive efficiency gains and cost savings.
Build, mentor, and lead a high-performing marketing team, fostering a collaborative and inclusive work environment.
Partner with senior leaders and x-functional teams to drive your agenda, including Pricing, Finance, Technology, Data Science, Design Services, Category Management, Physical Retail, Merchandising, Customer Service.
Engage with external agencies, vendors, and other stakeholders to leverage external expertise and amplify marketing efforts.
Develop and manage the marketing budget, ensuring efficient allocation of resources and maximum return on investment (ROI).
Partner with Finance to develop the brand forecast; monitor marketing spend and adjust as needed to ensure financial targets are met.

What Youll Need

10+ years of marketing experience, with a strong background in brand and performance marketing,  including physical retail experience. 
Demonstrated success in a senior marketing leadership role, preferably within the retail or consumer goods sector. Home,  design, or fashion industry experience is a plus.
Proven track record of driving growth, innovation, and brand excellence on a national scale.
Proficiency in data analytics, customer insights, and performance measurement tools.
Exceptional strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities.
Strong understanding of digital marketing channels, platforms, and technologies.
Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and results-oriented environment.

 Workflow Controller 
 
The Workflow Controller plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site(s) specific goals across Wayfair. They partner with others to ensure timely and cost efficient processing of the orders.
 
What You'll Do

You will create weekly and daily operating plans for site(s) and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for site plans at this cadence to align with Site leadership and network priorities.
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to short-mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan

Communicate with cross-functional leadership
Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements
Beyond optimizing plans and backlogs, you will also directly empower and lead a small, dedicated team of warehouse associates, fostering a high-performance environment and ensuring seamless execution of daily operations.
Provide leadership coverage, confidently supporting other teams, ensuring continuous operational excellence across the floor.

 
What You'll Need

2+ years relevant experience in supply chain
Excellent communication skills - Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.

Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Title: Software Engineer II, Customer Technology
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.

Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
Wayfair's Search and Recommendations team builds the core platforms and services that allow our customers to discover & buy the products they love. We have ambitious goals to improve this search functionality to better understand customer intent and map them to the most relevant products and searches on site.

What You'll Do:

Collaborate cross-functionally with product managers, UX designers, and backend engineers to understand business problems and translate them into responsive and performant front-end solutions.
Build scalable, maintainable, and highly interactive user interfaces using ReactJS, JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML5, and CSS3.
Work with RESTful APIs and ensure seamless data integration with backend services.
Use version control tools like Git for collaborative development and efficient release cycles.
Create and optimize cross-browser and cross-platform compatible applications.
Participate in writing unit tests and maintaining test coverage using tools like Jest or React Testing Library.
Contribute to full-stack development as needed using Java (Spring Boot) and SQL, particularly for understanding and integrating front-end components with backend services.
Collaborate in Agile teams and contribute to sprint planning, code reviews, and continuous improvement practices.
Utilize CI/CD pipelines and tools such as Jenkins, Docker, or Kubernetes to ensure reliable delivery of front-end applications.
Document technical solutions and maintain up-to-date knowledge of front-end best practices.

What You'll Need:

24 years of professional experience in front-end development using ReactJS and modern JavaScript (ES6+).
Strong understanding of HTML, CSS3, TypeScript, and responsive design principles.
Familiarity with backend technologies such as Java (Spring Boot) and experience writing or debugging SQL queries.
Experience integrating front-end components with REST APIs or GraphQL services.
Solid understanding of front-end state management patterns (e.g., Redux, Context API).
Basic understanding of containerised deployment environments such as Docker and Kubernetes.
Experience working with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure is a plus.
Knowledge of modern development tools and build systems (Webpack, Babel, NPM/Yarn).
Familiarity with Agile methodologies and DevOps practices.
Strong communication and collaboration skills to work across teams.
Good documentation skills for writing and maintaining technical specifications and project artifacts.

Nice to Have:

Familiarity with monitoring/logging tools like Elasticsearch, Grafana, or Prometheus.
Understanding of messaging systems like Kafka or Redis.

What you'll do on any given day as a merchant...
As a Merchant, you will build, curate, and maintain category assortment strategies for our marketing channels, inclusive of developing a shelf space plan and actively selecting and iterating on the product offering (own identifying and filling assortment gaps from strategic supplier catalogs). You will ultimately decide what products should be highlighted and amplified across all marketing channels with crisp business justification to support your selections and in alignment with key stakeholders. You will study the competitive market and collaborate with cross-functional partners in order to shape and solidify the direction for your category and to ensure it is competitive in product and price.  You are the product expert - you know our customers needs better than anyone else for your category and are constantly thinking about what tomorrows best sellers will be to continue to surprise and delight our target market.
Your success requires tenacity, agility, speed, an analytical mindset, collaboration, influence, and a competitive spirit. You'll use your executive presence to work with and influence stakeholders at all levels and navigate interesting, complex assortment challenges. You will own the performance results though regularly monitoring assortment health though various KPIs and OKRs.
